title: 'Sorry papa': Heartwrenching suicide note by Ghaziabad sisters before jumping from 9th floor
content: Three young sisters, aged 16, 14, and 12, tragically ended their lives by jumping from their ninth-floor Ghaziabad apartment. Investigators believe their alleged addiction to an online gaming app, coupled with parental restrictions and prolonged school absence since the pandemic, may have contributed to the devastating act.

title: Explained: What is Anthropic's AI tool that wiped $285 billion off software stocks in a single day
content: A swift market reaction, dubbed 'SaaSpocalypse,' saw software stocks plummet by $285 billion after Anthropic's AI assistant, Claude Cowork, launched new plugins.  The legal workflow automation plugin, in particular, triggered a selloff in legal tech and broader software sectors. Analysts now fear AI platforms are becoming direct competitors to existing software providers.

title: CCTV captures moment car hit Shehzad Poonawalla‚Äôs mother at petrol pump
content: In a shocking incident, political analyst Tehseen Poonawalla and BJP representative Shehzad Poonawalla have claimed that their elderly mother was intentionally struck by a vehicle in Pune, resulting in severe injuries that necessitated hip surgery. The harrowing CCTV footage reveals the moment of impact as the car accelerates away from the scene.

title: Sharad Pawar says Maharashtra CM Fadnavis 'was not involved' in NCP merger talks
content: Sharad Pawar stated that merger talks between Ajit Pawar and Jayant Patil occurred, asserting CM Fadnavis had no right to comment. He expressed happiness over Sunetra Pawar's Deputy CM appointment. Pawar also noted his unprecedented absence from Parliament on Budget Day due to a family tragedy, marking 58 years of attendance.

title: Teen gymnast dies after neck injury at school games
content: A 16-year-old gymnast from Madhya Pradesh, Ujair Ali, died after a severe neck injury sustained during the School Games Nationals in Kolkata. His family alleges negligence, claiming officials abandoned him at a government hospital. Ujair suffered a dislocation of his C4 and C5 vertebrae while attempting a double backflip.

title: 'Love game': What is the Korean task-based app the Ghaziabad sisters were addicted to?
content: Three minor sisters, aged 16, 14, and 12, died after allegedly jumping from a ninth-floor balcony in Ghaziabad. Police are investigating the role of a Korean 'love game' they were reportedly addicted to and had refused to give up. The girls had been excessively playing the task-based game since the Covid-19 period.

title: Mamata in Supreme Court as hearing on EC‚Äôs SIR to begin soon ‚Äî Key points
content: West Bengal chief minister and TMC supremo Mamata Banerjee approached the Supreme Court to contest the Election Commission's special intensive revision exercise. She had previously met with the Chief Election Commissioner Gyanesh Kumar to voice her objections, alleging humiliation during the encounter. A Supreme Court bench is set to hear the matter.

title: NCP uses AI-generated voice, video of Ajit Pawar to make emotional pitch in polls;
content: Ajit Pawar's party is using AI-generated audio and video clips mimicking the late leader's voice and image for ZP and panchayat samiti elections. These emotional messages aim to connect with voters by recalling his vision and trusted candidates. While intended to leverage his legacy, the tactic has sparked debate over ethical boundaries in political campaigning.

title: Oracle clarifies deal amid reports it may trigger layoffs of up to 30,000 employees
content: Oracle is defending its OpenAI partnership amid reports of potential job cuts to fund AI infrastructure. Despite a stalled Nvidia deal, Oracle remains confident in OpenAI's funding capabilities. However, the company's significant debt and market cap decline have raised investor concerns, highlighting the immense capital demands of the AI boom.

title: Shehzad Poonawalla's mother 'deliberately' run over by car, to undergo surgery
content: BJP spokesperson Shehzad Poonawalla alleged his mother was deliberately run over by a car in Pune, leaving her seriously injured. The accused reportedly fled the scene. Poonawalla's mother is set to undergo surgery, and he has appealed to the Pune police for the swift arrest of the perpetrator.

title: Gang assaults couple for holding hands in Tamil Nadu; attacks man‚Äôs parents
content: A five-member gang assaulted a 23-year-old man and his female friend for holding hands in Kelambakkam. The attackers also injured the man's parents when they arrived to support their son. Police have registered a case and are investigating the incident, with the victims having been threatened with further consequences.

title: Gold price prediction today: Will the rebound rally sustain? Here‚Äôs the outlook
content: Gold price prediction today: Gold and silver prices are recovering this week, but are expected to see volatility in the coming days, says Maneesh Sharma, AVP - Commodities & Currencies, Anand Rathi Shares and Stock Brokers. He shares his outlook for gold and silver prices in the coming days:

title: Elon Musk becomes first person on Earth worth $800 billion, here's his most precious asset
content: Elon Musk has become the first person to surpass $800 billion in net worth following the merger of SpaceX and xAI, valued at $1.25 trillion. This deal boosted his fortune to $852 billion, with his SpaceX stake now his most valuable asset. This marks his second major company merger in under a year.

title: Inside China‚Äôs gray zone activities: How Beijing is salami slicing its way to influence
content: China is employing a 'salami slicing' strategy, taking incremental steps across military, economic, and technological domains to alter realities without triggering conflict. This 'gray zone' approach, evident in the South China Sea and beyond, bypasses international law and exploits rivals' hesitation. The cumulative effect creates new facts on the ground, challenging the existing order.

title: Three minor sisters jump to death from 9th-floor in Ghaziabad; Korean game under scanner
content: In a devastating turn of events in Ghaziabad's Loni locality, three innocent sisters lost their lives following a tragic plummet from the ninth floor of their residential complex early Tuesday. Police officials are piecing together the timeline of this tragic fall, with early indications pointing to their involvement in an online gaming activity as a potential factor.

title: Snoop Dogg hails Lindsey Vonn‚Äôs Winter Olympics decision after torn ACL
content: Lindsey Vonn has drawn widespread attention after confirming plans to compete at the Milan-Cortina Winter Olympics despite tearing her ACL days earlier. Rap icon and honorary Team USA coach Snoop Dogg publicly praised her resolve, calling her a true champion. Vonn shared medical updates and reaffirmed her intent to race while continuing daily evaluations with her doctors.

title: Who was Saif al-Islam Gaddafi? Son of late Libya dictator Moammar Gaddafi killed in his home
content: Saif al-Islam Gaddafi, once seen as Libya's Western-friendly reformer and heir apparent, has been killed in a direct confrontation after gunmen stormed his home.  He played a key role in his father's regime, later becoming a divisive figure during the 2011 uprising.  After years of detention and a death sentence, he resurfaced seeking the presidency, a bid that ultimately failed.

title: Willow by Cricbuzz to stream Team USA T20 World Cup 2026 matches free on YouTube
content: Willow by Cricbuzz has announced major updates for the 2026 season, including free streaming of all four Team USA matches at the ICC Men‚Äôs T20 World Cup on YouTube for the first time. The platform has also partnered with Jomboy Media for creator-led alternate telecasts and unveiled a revamped, faster viewing experience across its apps and devices.

title: MCC rewrites cricket rulebook with 73 law changes: Check updates
content: Cricket's rulebook sees 73 significant updates from October, including mandatory completion of the final over in multi-day matches, even after a wicket falls. Wicketkeeper positioning is clarified, and the 'bunny hop catch' is removed. Laminated bats are now legal in open-age cricket, and new ball sizes are introduced for women and juniors. Overthrows are officially defined for the first time.

title: 'Last call at 8.37am': Ajit Pawar spoke to NCP leader 10 mins before plane crash
content: Minutes before his tragic plane crash, Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar spoke with Shreejit Pawar, emphasizing his commitment to inclusive politics and social harmony.  The conversation highlighted Pawar's dedication to uniting all communities and ensuring representation, reflecting his ongoing focus on justice for everyone.  The leader appeared calm during their final exchange.

title: Poetic protest: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee pens 26 poems against SIR
content: West Bengal chief minister Mamata Banerjee has authored a book of 26 poems, titled 'SIR: 26 in 26', as a literary protest against the Election Commission's intensive revision exercise. The collection, released at the International Kolkata Book Fair, expresses her resentment and alleges a "relentless campaign of fear" in Bengal.

title: 'I‚Äôve never seen you smile': Trump snaps at female reporter over Epstein question ‚Äî Watch
content: US President Donald Trump harshly criticized CNN reporter Kaitlan Collins during an Oval Office briefing, calling her "the worst reporter" and questioning her demeanor after she pressed him on the Jeffrey Epstein document release. Trump deflected questions about justice for survivors, suggesting the country move on to other issues, and asserted the matter was a "Democrat problem."

title: Nukes, defence, minerals: Inside Jaishankar-Rubio talks post India-US trade deal
content: External affairs minister S Jaishankar met US Secretary of State Marco Rubio in Washington, discussing expanded bilateral and multilateral cooperation, including through the Quad. The talks covered trade, defense, critical minerals, and energy, following a recently finalized trade deal. Both leaders emphasized strengthening economic ties and ensuring a prosperous Indo-Pacific region.

title: IT stocks crash: Infosys, TCS, Wipro down up to 6% - what's driving the fall?
content: Shares of major IT companies, including Infosys, Wipro, HCL Tech and Persistent Systems, slid as much as 6 per cent in early trade. The negative sentiment mirrored weakness on Wall Street, where the technology-heavy benchmark Nasdaq declined 1.4 per cent, erasing nearly $300 billion in market capitalisation across the sector.

title: Powerplay Warriors: India‚Äôs explosive top-order firepower will be hard to match
content: T20 cricket's Powerplay scoring has dramatically increased, with teams now targeting 75 runs for a strong start. India's explosive openers, led by Abhishek Sharma, are setting new benchmarks.  While other nations like England, New Zealand, and Australia also boast formidable opening pairs, India's aggressive approach, featuring a potential all-left-handed top order, promises thrilling encounters.

title: World Cancer Day 2026: 4 in 10 cases could be prevented, says WHO
content: Globally, four in ten cancer cases are preventable, with lung, stomach, and cervical cancers topping the list. In India, over a million cases arise annually, often diagnosed late due to low screening and awareness. Experts emphasize that tackling tobacco, infections, and alcohol, alongside promoting early detection and dispelling myths, is crucial to combatting this growing health challenge.

title: Rupee slips again: Currency down 22 paise to stand at 90.54 against US dollar
content: The Indian Rupee opened weaker on Wednesday. This followed a significant gain on Tuesday. The Rupee became the best performing Asian currency. This surge was due to a trade agreement reached between India and the United States. The deal is expected to boost foreign investment. This could further support the Rupee's stability.

title: Elon Musk calls Spanish PM 'dirty Sanchez' for proposing social media ban for minors
content: Elon Musk has fiercely criticized Spanish Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez's proposal to ban social media for children under 16. Sanchez aims to protect minors from online harms, likening the digital space to a "wild west." This move aligns with a broader European trend towards stricter tech regulations for young users.

title: Taekwondo master & first Indian recipient of 5th Dan, Yumnam Khemchand set to become Manipur CM
content: Manipur is set to get a new chief minister, BJP MLA Yumnam Khemchand Singh, a taekwondo expert, who was unanimously elected leader of the BJP legislature party. This move signals a power-sharing arrangement aimed at restoring peace in the strife-torn state, with a Kuki leader likely to be deputy chief minister.

title: Four masked gunmen, disabled security cameras: How Gaddafi's son was assassinated in Libya
content: Saif al-Islam Gaddafi, son of the former Libyan leader, has been killed at the age of 53 in Zintan, Libya. Masked gunmen reportedly assassinated him in his home, prompting an investigation by Libyan authorities. Gaddafi's son was once considered a successor to his father's regime and faced charges from the ICC.

title: T20 World Cup | PAK's boycott vs IND: How PCB is 'violating' ICC's participation rules
content: Pakistan‚Äôs decision to boycott only its T20 World Cup match against India has put the PCB on a collision course with the ICC. With no force majeure clause in the participation agreement, the move is being viewed as a contractual violation. The ICC is likely to question selective participation and potential government interference, with sanctions not ruled out.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens in red; BSE Sensex down over 250 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmarks, openedin red on Wednesday, a day after a strongly rally on the back of India-US trade deal announcement.

title: ‚ÄúTaylor‚Äôs going to kill me‚Äù: Travis Kelce jokes after accidentally breaking Swift‚Äôs prized item
content: Travis Kelce may be absent from Super Bowl LX, but his podcast moment with brother Jason kept him front and center. A cracked chair, a candid joke about Taylor Swift, and perfect timing turned a simple teaser into viral buzz. It proved Kelce‚Äôs star power extends far beyond the field.

title: 36-year-old Delhi businessman dies after being beaten with helmet by food delivery riders
content: A 36-year-old businessman tragically died after a road rage incident in Delhi's Connaught Place. Shivam Gupta was allegedly beaten with helmets by two food delivery riders following a minor collision. Despite initial recovery signs, Gupta succumbed to his injuries weeks later. Police have arrested two suspects, with a third reportedly involved in handing over the weapon.

title: World Cancer Day: The tests you keep postponing could actually save your life
content: World Cancer Day highlights a global surge in cancer cases, with India experiencing a significant increase. The 2026 theme, 'United by Unique,' emphasizes personalized care. Early detection through screening, though underutilized, is crucial, alongside lifestyle changes for prevention. Experts stress the importance of regular check-ups and addressing common warning signs.

title: Odisha girl survives night in jungle after kidnapping, attempted rape
content: An 18-year-old was arrested for allegedly kidnapping and attempting to rape a 14-year-old girl in a Kandhamal forest. The duo abducted the minor from a village pond, tore her clothes, and tried to assault her, but she resisted. The victim reported the incident to her parents, leading to the arrest of one accused.

title: Hyderabad techie files plaint against MNC over 16-hour workdays
content: A former MNC employee in Hyderabad has filed a complaint with the Telangana labour department, alleging forced overtime exceeding 16 hours daily for 14 years and seeking compensation. This case highlights a nationwide debate on working hours, with IT professionals confirming excessive work as an unwritten industry norm.

title: Dhoni backs India as T20 World Cup favourites but flags his biggest concern
content: Legendary captain MS Dhoni rates India as a formidable contender for the T20 World Cup, citing their immense experience and current form. However, he expressed concern over the impact of dew, which can significantly influence match outcomes. Dhoni also emphasized the inherent unpredictability of T20 cricket, where individual brilliance and player availability are crucial for success.

title: Agriculture, dairy shielded in India-US deal; trade pact in weeks
content: As a result, cereals, maize, soybean and genetically modified food may be kept out of the bilateral trade agreement, which has been in the works since last Feb. Goyal said that Modi had managed to secure a very good deal for India, which was better than what US had offered to some other competing countries. Indian and American officials are currently engaged in drafting a joint statement which is expected to be finalised in the next few days.

title: Top stocks to buy: Stock recommendations for today - check list
content: Stock market recommendations: According to Mehul Kothari, DVP - Technical Research, Anand Rathi Shares and Stock Brokers, the top stocks to buy today (February 4, 2026) are Indian Oil Corporation, Tata Elxsi, and IFCI. Let‚Äôs take a look:

title: T20 World Cup: Indispensable! Why Axar Patel remains India‚Äôs unsung MVP
content: Axar Patel‚Äôs career has been shaped by injuries, patience, and quiet excellence. From missing the 2023 ODI World Cup to starring in India‚Äôs 2024 T20 triumph, the all-rounder has grown into a vital cog across formats. Understated yet indispensable, a lot will depend on Axar's all-round skillsets in India's T20 World Cup title defence, starting from February 7.

title: 'Border 2': Sunny Deol starrer crosses Rs 286 crore despite declining numbers
content: 'Border 2' has made waves at the box office, raking in an impressive Rs 286.75 crore domestically and a staggering Rs 392.5 crore internationally. This gripping war drama, following in the footsteps of its 1997 predecessor, has experienced a slight downturn in attendance on its eleventh day but continues to captivate audiences.

title: MMA divisional rankings: Benoit Saint Denis, Mauricio Ruffy rise at lightweight
content: Saturday's UFC 325 was headlined by a meeting between the No. 1-ranked featherweight, champion  Alexander Volkanovski , and No. 2  Diego Lopes , a fight won by the champ. But it was one weight class heavier where the fight card impacted the ESPN divisional MMA rankings. Lightweight  Beno√Æt Saint Denis  knocked out  Dan Hooker  in the co-main event to move up three spots to No. 7. And in the fight right before that,  Mauricio Ruffy  scored a knockout of  Rafael Fiziev  to earn a place in the top 10. Those were the only changes in the rankings. Here are the  ESPN pound-for-pound MMA rankings  and a  list of current UFC champions  in all weight classes. Results are current; rankings as of Feb. 3. To be eligible for the rankings, a fighter must have competed over the past 12 months or must have an upcoming fight booked. Fighters who have been dropped for inactivity can be reinstated only after they compete.

title: State of MLB: Has the Dodgers' dominance propelled the NL past the AL?
content: the national league was founded in 1876 by the Chicago White Stockings officer . it was a loose affiliation of clubs that had problems with competitive balance . in 1901, the American League declared itself a competitor to the NL, jumping up from its minor league status .
